If the linear transformation \\( L \\) is applied to a vector field configuration at t = 0 and the system is allowed to evolve under its natural dynamics without further intervention, will particle trajectories be fundamentally altered compared to their behavior without applying \\( L \\)?
Explanation: Applying the linear transformation \\( L \\) modifies the initial orientation of the vector field, changing how particles react to the field. The resulting trajectories will be different as the rotation can change the effective dynamics that guide the particles.
